source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_041_chunk6
evidence_span: Nuclear reactor coolants containing dissolved oxygen are aggressive toward zirconium and its alloys at high-flux locations

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_041_chunk6
evidence_span: Accelerated attack also may occur in deoxygenated coolants, but the degree of acceleration generally is small

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_041_chunk7
evidence_span: Oxygenated coolants appear to accelerate the development of oxide porosity.

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_041_chunk7
evidence_span: Transfer of rapidly oxidizing specimens to a less aggressive environment decreases corrosion rates, provided that oxides are sufficiently thin.

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_041_chunk7
evidence_span: Prefilming suppresses rapid attack in an oxygenated coolant

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_041_chunk7
evidence_span: prefilmed coupons generally exhibit accelerated attack in deoxygenated coolants

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_041_chunk7
evidence_span: Zr-2.5Nb (quenched, cold-worked, aged) had the lowest corrosion and hydriding rates of the alloys and conditions tested in both ATR environments

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_041_chunk7
evidence_span: Zr-2.5Nb (quenched, cold-worked, aged) had the lowest corrosion and hydriding rates of the alloys and conditions tested in both ATR environments

evidence_span: Specimens of Zircaloy-2 have been exposed at 240°C (464°F) in various locations in the primary circuit of the Halden Boiling Water Reactor (HBWR)

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_041_chunk7
evidence_span: The radiation field caused a drastic enhancement of the attack, corrosion rates increased a hundred times

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_041_chunk7
evidence_span: corrosion rates increased a hundred times, and was under normal conditions about 0.15 mg/dm² per day for pickled, anodized, and autoclaved material

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_041_chunk7
evidence_span: Variations in the flux level from 2×10⁹ to 3×10¹² neutrons/cm²·s (>1 MeV) had little influence on the corrosion rate

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_041_chunk7
evidence_span: When uranium was present in the water, the corrosion rate increased for pickled and for autoclaved fuel rods

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_041_chunk7
evidence_span: hardly any effect was observed with anodized material

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_041_chunk7
evidence_span: A deliberate fluoride contamination on the specimens increased the corrosion rate in-pile as well as out-of-pile

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_041_chunk7
evidence_span: By anodizing this harmful effect of fluorides could be completely counteracted
